title.a: Update Traffic Collision with Fire 07/01/2024 INC#1671

item.description: Update Traffic Collision with Fire; INC#1671; 08:15PM; 13136 W Sherman Wy; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3xKa9eb" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3xKa9eb</a>; #ValleyGlen; One vehicle with two occupants collided directly into the rear of a vehicle parked curbside, which created a chain-reaction collision ultimately causing damage to four vehicles (one occupied and moving, and three unoccupied and parked-in-line). Though the errant vehicle caught fire shortly after the collision and was well involved on firefighter's arrival, the two adult male occupants of that car had been able to extract themselves from the wreckage prior to fire department arrival. The flames were quickly confined to the errant vehicle and the first vehicle it collided with. The two men, one in fair condition, the other in serious condition, were taken to an area hospital by LAFD Paramedics. No other injuries were reported. Media Inquiries: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #4255).; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; E289 E89 EM14 RA102 RA881 T89; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#1671; 07:38PM; 13136 W Sherman Wy; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3xKa9eb" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3xKa9eb</a>; #ValleyGlen; PRELIM: Two or more vehicle collision with one vehicle fully involved with fire. One patient (details pending).; FS 89; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 2; E289 E89 RA102 T89; CH8; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire, Outside City; INC#0059; 01:13AM; 24777 W Woolsey Canyon Rd; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4eE5T0x" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4eE5T0x</a>; #OutsideCity; LAFD fire crews headed back out to Woolsey Canyon tonight, to assist LA County and Ventura County Fire Departments in containing what grew to a 4-acre patch of brush, pushed by 2-3 mph winds. This has been dubbed the "Dora Incident," and forward progress of the fire was declared stopped within approximately 30 minutes. Four of the LAFD companies dispatched as Automatic Aid will remain staged and await orders as hot spots are doused and the threat of rekindle is abated.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; AO1 AO2 BC15 BC17 E104 E105 E106 E107 E296 E305 E72 E84 E90 EM17 H1 H5 HA1 HA5 RA106 T105 T96; CH5; 17; Lyndsey Lantz

Update KNOCKDOWN Structure Fire; INC#1534; 08:38PM; 1390 E Newton St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3zpfUyp" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3zpfUyp</a>; #Downtown; Over 80 firefighters coordinated to extinguish the blaze in this 100' x 50' commercial building in 48 minutes. All nearby exposures were protected, with no injuries or fatalities reported. Extensive damage, due to multiple previous burns, will be evaluated by the Los Angeles Department of Building and Safety. LAFD Heavy Equipment crews are on standby for possible demolition, in the event the structure is deemed unsafe. The cause of the fire is under investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E14 E17 E203 E209 E210 E215 E221 E27 E3 E4 E9 EM1 HE1 HR3 RA14 RA3 RA809 SO1 SQ21 T10 T15 T21 T3 T9 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Lyndsey Lantz

Structure Fire; INC#1534; 07:50PM; 1390 E Newton St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3zpfUyp" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3zpfUyp</a>; #Downtown; First-arriving companies report a 2-story, 100' x 50' commercial building, site of a previous burn, fully involved with fire. Crews are in defensive mode: prioritizing firefighter safety, protecting exposed buildings nearby, and fighting fire with heavy streams from the exterior.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 E14 E209 E210 E9 RA14 RA809 T10 T9; CH9; 13; Lyndsey Lantz

Hiker Rescue; INC#1350; 05:59PM; Mt Lukens Rd; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4cJw6ZK" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4cJw6ZK</a>; #Tujunga; LAFD air resources have located a hiker and his three dogs in a remote location on the north side of Mt. Lukens -- the hiker had called 911 for aid just before losing his cellular connection. An LAFD helicopter lowered a paramedic to assess the 61-year-old male, who was dehydrated and unable to walk out of the location under his own power. An extended helicopter hoisting operation is currently underway -- the patient's three dogs will first be extracted to a safe location, and then the patient will be rescued and flown to a local hospital for treatment.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 BP74 E24 E274 H0E H1 H4 HA1 HA4 RA74 RA77 RH114 T74; CH8; 17; Lyndsey Lantz

Structure Fire, Automatic Aid; INC#0886; 01:23PM; 733 Salem St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/3xPSjq1" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/3xPSjq1</a>; #Glendale; Two LAFD companies are currently on-scene in Glendale to assist with a 5th alarm structure fire that has extended significantly since inception. We respectfully refer media inquiries to Glendale Fire and Verdugo Fire Communications Center for timely and reliable incident information.; FS 50; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District outside city; BC11 BC2 E235 E250 T35 T50; CH7; 12; Lyndsey Lantz

Brush Fire; INC#0927; 01:36PM; 24707 W Woolsey Canyon Rd; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4eE5T0x" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4eE5T0x</a>; #OutsideCity; LAFD resources have been dispatched in a mutual aid effort to support LA County Fire and Ventura County Fire, from both the ground and the air, to contain a brush fire in Woolsey Canyon. LAFD is currently staged and not engaged in firefighting. ; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District outside city; AO1 AO2 BC15 BC17 CW3B E103 E105 E106 E107 E296 E305 E70 E72 E84 EM17 H1 HA1 RA96 T105 T96; CH5; 18; Lyndsey Lantz

title.a: Traffic Collision with Person Trapped 06/30/2024 INC#0782

item.description: Traffic Collision with Person Trapped; INC#0782; 12:24PM; 10850 W Penrose St; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/45KBZU0" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/45KBZU0</a>; #ShadowHills; A two-vehicle traffic collision resulted in four total patients; one person was pinned in their vehicle and required extrication by firefighters. All four patients were transported by LAFD ambulances to local hospitals.; FS 77; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; BC12 E24 E289 E298 E77 EM14 HR3 RA89 RA91 T89 T98 UR88; CH8; 17; Lyndsey Lantz

Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0374; 06:59AM; 8100 W Sunset Bl; MAP: <a href="https://bit.ly/4eJ4R3e" target="_blank" rel="noopener">https://bit.ly/4eJ4R3e</a>; #HollywoodHillsWest; First-arriving companies reported a one-story single family dwelling with fire showing from the front. Firefighters proceeded in offensive mode -- breaching entrances to fight fire and search for victims, and ascending to the roof to ventilate pressurized smoke and heat. Full extinguishment accomplished in 35 minutes with 37 firefighters on-scene. Fire cause is unknown and under investigation.; FS 41; Batt 5; West Bureau; Council District 4; BC18 BC5 E227 E261 E27 E61 E97 RA27 RA827 T27 T61; CH9; 12; Lyndsey Lantz
